Detailed Description

The ColrHandler is a SS handler responsible for interrogating the Connected Line Identification Restriction SS. The class provides methods to query to current COLR status and to convert the stack-message-arguments into Apoxi-messages. It relies heavily on methods provided by its superclass.

SsBaseHandler::ReturnCode ColrHandler::CreateInterrogateResultMsg (  const SsInterrogateIndArg &  arg,
SsMessage *&  msg
)  const [protected, virtual]
 

Creates a specific Apoxi-message based on the given argument. The message is statically created, cloned and the pointer parameter set to the clone.

Parameters:
arg The argument which contains the data and needs to be parsed.
msg A reference to a message-pointer which will be set to the new message.
Returns:
OkNoMessage

ColrHandlerId

SsApiRc ColrHandler::RequestStatus (  const WString &  override_ss_seq = L"",
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE
) 
 

Interrogates the COLR status. This method triggers sending of *#77# to the mobile network. The actual function is delegated to the Interrogate method of the super class.

Parameters:
override_ss_seq Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
Returns:
Success - if the mobile network accepted the supplementary service request,
SupplementaryServicePending - if another supplementary service is currently pending,
SupplementaryServiceDenied - if the supplementary service request was rejected by the mobile network,
NormalServiceRequired - if the network service state is invalid.
See also:
SsClHandler
